kawigi.language
Class EditorLanguage

java.lang.Object
  kawigi.language.EditorLanguage
Direct Known Subclasses:
CPPLang, CSharpLang, JavaLang, VBLang
public abstract class EditorLanguage
extends java.lang.Object

Class introducing methods for working with language-specific features including test code generation and parsing. All constants controlling test code generation are put at the beginning of the class. First there are constants used as variable names in test code. They are followed by constants containing language-specific structures and operators.

Field Detail

sTestParamVarPrefix

protected static final java.lang.String sTestParamVarPrefix
The prfix to variables that will appear in test code as test parameters and desired answer. This will be added by parameter number.

See Also:
sArrayParamVarPrefix, Constant Field Values

nMaxCodeLineLength

protected static final int nMaxCodeLineLength
Maximum length of one line in generated code. In fact it can slightly vary (for example it can be 1010 characters), but this is the number which generator respects when makes test case parameters constants.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

sDeleteObjOp

protected java.lang.String sDeleteObjOp
String that will place in code operator of deletion of problem solver object in current language. If this string is empty then deletion of object is not necessary. If it's not empty it is appended by name of the object variable to form deletion operator.

sStringsAdd

protected java.lang.String sStringsAdd
String that will put code concatenating different strings into one string in test case parameters at the end of the line. Concatenation operator must be with space separator for test code beauty.

sLineContinued

protected java.lang.String sLineContinued
Code line continuation string. Necessary mostly for VB.

sArrayParamVarPrefix

protected java.lang.String sArrayParamVarPrefix
The prfix to array variables that will appear in test code before array initializers. It is necessary mostly for C++ where vector initialization is made via additional variable.

See Also:
sTestParamVarPrefix

sDefaultFileName

protected java.lang.String sDefaultFileName
Default file name for local saving. Value depends on current language.

sDefaultCompileCommand

protected java.lang.String sDefaultCompileCommand

Default command for local execution of compiled code. Value depends on current language.

sCurIndent

protected java.lang.StringBuilder sCurIndent
Buffer containing current line indentation in test code.

paramVarNames

protected java.lang.String[] paramVarNames
Array of all test case parameters names. Collected here so that different methods can use it without recreation of these strings.

Constructor Detail

EditorLanguage

protected EditorLanguage()
Default constructor. Can be called only from derived classes representing concrete languages.

Method Detail

fillTypeNames

protected final void fillTypeNames(java.lang.String[] propTypes)
Method for filling EditorDataType to type name correspondence

Parameters:
propTypes - Array of type names. It should have the same number of elements as number of elements in EditorDataType. Each element in array have to represent respective (by index) data type in EditorDataType

getType

public static EditorDataType getType(java.lang.CharSequence name)

Parameters:
name - Type name to convert
Returns:

comment

protected final void comment(java.lang.String comm)
Inserts comment to code. Automatically finishes current line.

Parameters:
comm - Comment string to be inserted

preamble

protected void preamble()
Specific function for inserting some stuff before code generation starts. By default does nothing.

postamble

protected void postamble()
Specific function for inserting some stuff after code generation ended but is not finalized yet. Made specially for C# and VB. By default does nothing.

funcDefPrefix

protected abstract EditorLanguage funcDefPrefix(EditorDataType funcRetType)
Abstract function for inserting prefix of function header - the part that is put before function name. This function must place space character at the end.

Parameters:
funcRetType - The return type of function
Returns:
All methods of EditorLanguage related to test code generation return this to make possible convinient call chains
See Also:
funcDefPostfix(EditorDataType)

funcDefPostfix

protected void funcDefPostfix(EditorDataType funcRetType)
Function for inserting postfix of function header - the part that is put after closing parenthesis after parameters list. By default puts open curly bracket and finishes the code line 'cause this is all that needed in most of the languages. Method must put space character at the beginning if it's needed to separate function parameters' parenthesis and further text. Also finishing of code line and indenting further text is mandatory in this method.

Parameters:
funcRetType - The return type of function
See Also:
funcDefPrefix(EditorDataType)

funcDefParam

protected EditorLanguage funcDefParam(java.lang.String paramName,
                                      EditorDataType paramType)
Puts parameter of the function to its definition (not call).

Parameters:
paramName - Name of function parameter
paramType - Type of function parameter
Returns:
All methods of EditorLanguage related to test code generation return this to make possible convinient call chains

Parameters:
arrayName - Name of the variable to be iterated

iterLastLine()

protected final EditorLanguage iff()
Inserts if operator.

Returns:
All methods of EditorLanguage related to test code generation return this to make possible convinient call chains
See Also:
then(), els(), elseIf(), endIf()

then

protected final void then()
Inserts then operator or what is needed instead of it in this particular language. Method automatically goes to the next code line.

See Also:
iff(), els(), elseIf(), endIf()

arrayIndex

protected final EditorLanguage arrayIndex(boolean isArray)
Adds array index i with language-specific brackets only if variable in input is true. Or does nothing if variable in input is false.

Parameters:
isArray - Flag pointing if it needs do something.
Returns:
All methods of EditorLanguage related to test code generation return this to make possible convinient call chains

varDeclare

protected void varDeclare(java.lang.CharSequence varName,
                          java.lang.CharSequence typeName)
Declares the variable. Variable can be any of builtin types or a class of problem-solver object.

Parameters:
varName - Name of the variable to be declared.
typeName - Type of the variable to be declared.

rememberCurTime

protected abstract void rememberCurTime(java.lang.String varName)
Abstract method for adding code of remembering current time. Necessary for checking running time of test cases.

Parameters:
varName - Name of variable to remember time in.

timeDiff

protected abstract EditorLanguage timeDiff(java.lang.String varStart,
                                           java.lang.String varEnd)
Abstract method for adding formula counting difference between two time points stored in two different variables in seconds (double value).

Parameters:
varStart - Variable name of starting moment
varEnd - Variable name of ending moment
Returns:
All methods of EditorLanguage related to test code generation return this to make possible convinient call chains

equal

protected EditorLanguage equal(java.lang.String varLeft,
                               java.lang.String varRight,
                               EditorDataType type,
                               boolean isNotEqual)
Adds code of (in)equality checking on two variables that can be array. In latter case the array elements (in)equality checking takes place. Method respects TopCoder double values tolerance. In case of double comparison relative error is calculated according to right variable.

Parameters:
varLeft - Name of first variable to compare
varRight - Name of second variable to compare
type - Type of variables to compare
isNotEqual - flag pointing if equal (false) or not-equal (true) sign must be used
Returns:
All methods of EditorLanguage related to test code generation return this to make possible convinient call chains
See Also:
equal(String, String, EditorDataType), unequal(String, String, EditorDataType)

mainSubDef

protected void mainSubDef()
Adds header of main procedure. All signatures of main procedure in different languages are not alike, so this method does here only identical stuff that need to be done at the end in each language.

endMainSub

protected void endMainSub()
Adds code finalizing main procedure.

markTestBegin

protected void markTestBegin(int num)
Adds mark of the beginning of test. This mark will be used at code loading to find the place where test data begins.

Parameters:
num - Number of the test
See Also:
getTestBeginPat()

markTestEnd

protected void markTestEnd()
Adds mark of ending of the code related to one test case. This mark is made basically on beauty of generated code purposes.

getNumTypePrefix

protected java.lang.String getNumTypePrefix(EditorDataType type)
Gets prefix for given data type in this language. Retrieved via method and not constant 'cause it can change in runtime via properties' changing (for C++ implemented only).

Parameters:
type - Data type to check for prefix.
Returns:
Prefix string for this type and language.
See Also:
getNumTypePostfix(EditorDataType)

getNumTypePostfix

protected java.lang.String getNumTypePostfix(EditorDataType type)
Gets postfix for given data type in this language. Retrieved via method and not constant 'cause it can change in runtime via properties' changing (for C++ implemented only).

Parameters:
type - Data type to check for postfix.
Returns:
Postfix string for this type and language.
See Also:
getNumTypePrefix(EditorDataType)

escapeSequences

protected void escapeSequences(java.lang.StringBuilder val,
                               EditorDataType type)
Escapes all special characters in string constants or string-array constants. All changes are made inplace. And all changes are made assuming that elements in string array enclosed in quotes with escaped inner quotes and backslashes.
Method now works around only quotes and backslashes because I (Pavel Ivanov aka pivanof) didn't see in TopCoder problems any other escape-sequences used.

Parameters:
val - In input it's constant to be escaped, in output it's escaped constant ready for inserting in code.
type - Data type represented by given constant.
See Also:
unescapeSequences(StringBuilder, EditorDataType)

initArrayParam

protected void initArrayParam(int num,
                              EditorDataType type,
                              java.lang.StringBuilder value)
Adds code of array test case parameter initializing. Method have to end the code line.

Parameters:
num - Sequential number of the parameter
type - Type of the parameter
value - Value of the parameter ready for inserting into the code
See Also:
initTestParam(int, EditorDataType, StringBuilder)

getTestCode

public final java.lang.String getTestCode(ClassDecl classProblem)
Makes full generation of test code and returns it as String.

Parameters:
classProblem - Problem class information for test code
Returns:
Generated test code

unescapeSequences

protected void unescapeSequences(java.lang.StringBuilder val,
                                 EditorDataType type)
Removes all escapings in string and string-array constants made by escapeSequences. Method assumes that in string array in output we need all elements to be enclosed in quotes and all inner quotes and backslashes to be escaped. All changes are made inplace.
Method now works around only quotes and backslashes because I (Pavel Ivanov aka pivanof) didn't see in TopCoder problems any other escape-sequences used.

Parameters:
val - In input it's escaped constant taken from code, in output it's constant ready for showing to end-user
type - Data type represented by given constant
See Also:
escapeSequences(StringBuilder, EditorDataType)

protected java.lang.String getTestParamRegex(int num,
                                             EditorDataType type)
Gets regular expression for finding test case parameter initialization.

Parameters:
num - Number of parameter
type - Type of parameter
Returns:
Regular expression for finding this parameter in code

addTestCase

public void addTestCase(ClassDecl classProblem,
                        java.lang.StringBuilder[] aParams,
                        java.lang.StringBuilder aResult)
Adds test case constructed from external parameters to class definition. Before creating test object all parameters and result are cleaned out by extractValFromCode. If test case must be without answer then aResult must be null.

Parameters:
classProblem - Class definition to add test case to
aParams - Array of test case parameters' values
aResult - Result value of test case or null if this test must be without answer
See Also:
extractValFromCode(StringBuilder, EditorDataType)

extractTestCases

public final void extractTestCases(java.lang.StringBuilder code,
                                   ClassDecl classProblem,
                                   java.lang.StringBuilder testCode)
Main function for extracting test cases from program code. Method deletes test code in code, put this test code in testCode, parses all test cases in it and puts them into classProblem.

Parameters:
code - All program code for analyzing
classProblem - Class definition for receiving test cases
testCode - Buffer for receiving test code deleted from code
